Submodules

generator.generator module

class generator.generator.Generator(n_customers=50, n_terminals=10, radius=20, nb_days=8, start_date='2018-04-01', random_state=2, max_days_from_compromission=3)[source]

Bases: object

A class for generating synthetic transactions data.

This class can be used to generate a synthetic transactions dataset for use in testing or evaluation of fraud detection systems. The dataset includes information about customers, terminals, and the transactions themselves, and can be exported in various formats.

n_customers

The number of customers to include in the dataset.

Type

int

n_terminals

The number of terminals to include in the dataset.

Type

int

radius

The radius within which a customer can use a terminal.

Type

int

nb_days

The number of days of transactions to generate.

Type

int

start_date

The starting date for the transaction period.

Type

str

random_state

The random seed to use for generating the data.

Type

int

max_days_from_compromission

The maximum number of days from a terminal’s compromission to a transaction.

Type

int

terminal_profiles_table

A table containing information about each terminal in the dataset.

Type

pandas.DataFrame

customer_profiles_table

A table containing information about each customer in the dataset.

Type

pandas.DataFrame

x_y_terminals

The x-y coordinates of each terminal.

Type

numpy.ndarray

fraudsters_mean

The mean transaction amount for fraudsters.

Type

float

fraudsters_var

The variance in transaction amount for fraudsters.

Type

float

generate()[source]

Generate the synthetic transactions dataset.

export(filename

str, format: str): Export the generated dataset to a file.

_generate_transactions_table(customer_profile

pandas.DataFrame): Generate a table of transactions for a given customer.

export(filename: str = 'transactions.csv', format: str = 'csv') → None[source]

Exports the transactions data to a file.

This function saves the transactions data stored in the transactions_df attribute of this object to a file with the specified filename and format. If format is ‘csv’, the data is saved as a CSV file. If format is ‘pkl’, the data is pickled and saved to a binary file.

Parameters

  • filename (str) – The name of the file to save the data to.

  • format (str) – The format to use for saving the data. Must be ‘csv’ or ‘pkl’.

Returns

None

generate() → None[source]

Generates transactions data for the customers in this dataset.

This function groups the customer profiles by customer ID and then generates transactions data for each group using the _generate_transactions_table function. The generated transactions data is stored in the transactions_df attribute of this object.

Returns

None
